symptom_short: Rough idle or shaking when stopped
symptom_patterns: engine feels like it will stall

likely_causes.notes: Common on high-mileage engines or if maintenance is overdue.
May be worse when engine is cold.
Can eventually trigger check-engine light and poor fuel economy.

recommended_checks: Check maintenance history for last spark-plug change.
Listen for hissing sounds around intake hoses.
Scan for misfire or fuel-trim codes with an OBD-II scanner.
safety_warning: Avoid hard acceleration until the misfire cause is identified. Severe misfires can damage the catalytic converter.

symptom_short: Flashing check-engine light under load

likely_causes.notes: Unburned fuel can overheat and destroy the catalytic converter.
Often happens under heavy load or uphill driving.

recommended_checks: If the light is flashing, reduce speed and avoid hard acceleration.
If the flashing continues, safely pull over and shut off the engine.
Scan for misfire codes (e.g., P0300–P0306).
safety_warning: A flashing check-engine light usually means STOP DRIVING soon. Continuing to drive can cause very expensive damage.

symptom_short: Hard starting when engine is cold

likely_causes.cause: Weak battery or poor battery connections
Fuel system issue (weak pump or leaking injector)

recommended_checks: Check battery age and look for corrosion on terminals.
Notice if the problem is only on cold mornings or always.
Listen for fuel-pump prime sound when turning key to ON.
safety_warning: If the engine cranks very slowly, avoid repeated attempts that overheat the starter and cables.

symptom_short: Engine overheating in traffic but OK at highway speed

likely_causes.cause: Cooling fan not working (electric fan or clutch fan)

recommended_checks: With engine cool, visually check radiator and condenser for blockage.
With AC on and engine warm, verify if cooling fans turn on.
Watch temperature gauge; if it enters red zone, shut engine off safely.
safety_warning: Do not continue driving an overheating engine. Severe overheating can warp the cylinder head and cause head-gasket failure.

symptom_short: Engine overheating mainly at highway speeds
recommended_checks: With engine cool, check coolant level in reservoir.
Look for dried coolant traces around hoses, radiator, and water pump.
Observe for sweet smell or steam from engine bay.
safety_warning: Never open the radiator cap while the engine is hot. Hot coolant can spray and cause serious burns.

symptom_short: No heat from cabin vents but engine reaches normal temp
recommended_checks: Check coolant level when engine is cold.
Note if windshield fogs with sweet smell (may indicate heater-core leak).
Check if both heater hoses in engine bay feel warm when engine is hot.
safety_warning: Coolant leaks that affect the heater can eventually lead to engine overheating if ignored.

symptom_short: High-pitched squeal when braking at low speed

likely_causes.cause: Brake wear indicator contacting rotor (pads near end of life)
Dust or rust on rotor surface after sitting

recommended_checks: Notice if noise happens only first few stops of the day or always.
Check for visible pad thickness through wheel spokes if possible.
Have a technician inspect pad and rotor condition.
safety_warning: If the squeal turns into a grinding or scraping sound, stop driving — you may be down to metal-on-metal brakes.

symptom_short: Grinding or scraping noise when braking

likely_causes.cause: Pads worn through to metal backing plate

recommended_checks: Avoid driving except to move the car to a safe location.
Have brakes inspected as soon as possible.
Check for brake warning lights on dashboard.
safety_warning: Driving with grinding brakes is unsafe and can cause rotor failure and loss of braking ability.

symptom_short: Soft or spongy brake pedal
recommended_checks: Press and hold the brake pedal at a stop; note if it slowly sinks.
Look for fluid leaks near wheels or under brake master cylinder.
Do not continue driving if braking ability is reduced.
safety_warning: A soft pedal can mean imminent brake failure. Tow the vehicle rather than driving it.

symptom_short: Battery/charging light on while driving
recommended_checks: Turn off non-essential electrical loads (AC, heated seats, rear defrost).
Notice if lights dim or blower slows down.
Have charging system tested as soon as possible.
safety_warning: Once the battery is depleted, the engine may stall suddenly. Avoid long trips and night driving until fixed.

symptom_short: Headlights dim at idle but brighten when revving

likely_causes.cause: Weak alternator output at low RPM
High electrical load at idle (AC, defrost, audio)

recommended_checks: Observe if dimming is worse with AC or rear defrost on.
Check battery age and condition.
Ask for charging-system and ground-circuit inspection.
safety_warning: Severe dimming or flickering can precede alternator failure, which may stall the engine while driving.

symptom_short: Single click or rapid clicking, engine does not crank
symptom_patterns: rapid click sound from engine bay
recommended_checks: Check if interior lights are dim or go out when trying to start.
Inspect battery terminals for white/green corrosion.
Note if problem is worse after car sits overnight.
safety_warning: Repeated attempts to crank with a weak battery can overheat cables and the starter. Avoid cranking for more than 10 seconds at a time.

symptom_short: Clunking noise over bumps at low speed

likely_causes.cause: Worn stabilizer bar (sway bar) links or bushings
Loose strut mount or worn strut

recommended_checks: Note if the sound is from front, rear, or one side only.
Check if noise is louder when turning and going over bumps.
Have suspension inspected on a lift.
safety_warning: Severely worn suspension parts can affect steering control, especially during emergency maneuvers.

symptom_short: Squeaking suspension at low speed or entering driveway
recommended_checks: Notice if sound changes with temperature or rain.
Check if squeak occurs while steering, braking, or only with body motion.
Schedule suspension inspection if persistent.
safety_warning: While often not immediately dangerous, squeaks can be an early sign of wear that later affects steering safety.

symptom_short: Vibration in steering wheel or seat at highway speeds

likely_causes.cause: Uneven tire wear or belt separation

recommended_checks: Note the speed range where vibration is worst.
Check tires visually for bulges, flat spots, or exposed cords.
Have wheels balanced and alignment checked.
safety_warning: Severe tire defects can lead to blowouts at speed. Reduce speed and inspect tires if vibration is strong or sudden.

symptom_short: Automatic transmission slipping or delayed engagement
symptom_patterns: engine revs but car doesn't move
recommended_checks: Check for transmission warning lights.
Notice if slipping is worse when hot or when towing.
Have fluid level and condition inspected according to manufacturer procedure.
safety_warning: Continuing to drive with a slipping transmission can lead to complete failure and loss of drive.

symptom_short: Harsh or banging shifts in automatic transmission

likely_causes.cause: Software adaptation issue or dirty transmission fluid

recommended_checks: Note if harsh shifts happen only when cold or also when warm.
Check for check-engine or transmission warning lights.
Have transmission fluid level and condition checked.
safety_warning: Very harsh shifting can stress driveline components and should be inspected, especially on high-power vehicles.

symptom_short: Loud rumble or roar from exhaust

likely_causes.cause: Hole or crack in exhaust pipe or muffler
Broken exhaust hanger letting system touch body

recommended_checks: Listen if noise increases with acceleration.
Check if sound comes more from rear or middle of vehicle.
Inspect for exhaust smell inside cabin.
safety_warning: Exhaust leaks near the cabin can allow carbon monoxide inside the car. If you smell exhaust inside, drive with windows open and repair soon.

symptom_short: Rotten-egg or sulfur smell from exhaust

likely_causes.cause: Engine running too rich (too much fuel)

recommended_checks: Note if check-engine light is on with fuel-system codes.
Observe if smell is worse after hard acceleration.
Have fuel trims and catalytic converter efficiency checked.
safety_warning: Long-term driving with a failing converter or rich mixture can damage emissions system and increase fuel consumption.

symptom_short: AC blows warm air instead of cold
recommended_checks: Check if AC clutch engages when AC is turned on.
Observe if cooling improves while driving at highway speed versus at a stop.
Look for oily residue on AC hoses and connections (may indicate leak).
safety_warning: AC issues are usually not a direct safety problem but can be important in hot climates for driver alertness and comfort.

symptom_short: Strong fuel smell inside or around vehicle

likely_causes.cause: Fuel leak from line, injector, or tank
likely_causes.notes: Any visible wet fuel or dripping is a fire risk.

likely_causes.cause: Evap system leak (EVAP hose or canister)

recommended_checks: Do not smoke or use open flames near the vehicle.
Check that fuel cap is tight and sealing.
Look under car for wet spots or dripping fuel.
safety_warning: If the fuel smell is strong or you see liquid fuel, avoid driving and have the car inspected immediately.

symptom_short: Car pulls to one side while driving straight

likely_causes.cause: Brake caliper sticking on one wheel

recommended_checks: Check tire pressures and adjust to spec.
Notice if wheel or brake on one side feels hotter after driving.
Schedule alignment check if pull persists.
safety_warning: Severe pulling, especially under braking, can affect your ability to keep the car in its lane.

symptom_short: Loose feeling or play in steering wheel

likely_causes.cause: Worn tie-rod ends or steering rack components
Improper alignment or worn suspension bushings

recommended_checks: Note if steering response feels delayed when turning.
Observe if car wanders and needs constant correction on highway.
Have steering and suspension checked on a lift.
safety_warning: Serious steering looseness is a safety hazard and can lead to loss of control, especially at speed.

symptom_short: ABS warning light stays on
recommended_checks: Note if ABS activates too early or not at all on hard braking.
Scan ABS system for codes using capable scanner.
Inspect wheel-speed sensor wiring near wheels for damage.
safety_warning: Conventional braking usually still works, but anti-lock function may be disabled. Increase following distance on wet or slippery roads.

symptom_short: Tire pressure warning (TPMS) light on

likely_causes.cause: Low tire pressure in one or more tires
TPMS sensor battery low or failed

recommended_checks: Check tire pressure with a gauge; fill to door-jamb specification.
Inspect tires for nails, screws, or visible damage.
If pressures are OK but light stays on, have sensors checked.
safety_warning: Driving on an under-inflated tire can cause overheating, poor handling, and potential blowout.

symptom_short: Pinging or knocking sound under acceleration

likely_causes.cause: Incorrect ignition timing or sensor issue

recommended_checks: Try a tank of higher-octane fuel recommended by manufacturer.
Notice if noise only occurs when engine is heavily loaded.
Have engine checked for knock-sensor or timing issues.
safety_warning: Prolonged heavy knock can damage pistons and connecting rods.

symptom_short: Oil pressure light flickers at idle but goes off when revving

likely_causes.cause: Low oil level or old, thin oil
Worn oil pump or engine bearings

recommended_checks: Check oil level immediately with dipstick on level ground.
Listen for ticking or knocking noises from the engine.
Avoid high RPM until cause is identified.
safety_warning: Low oil pressure can cause catastrophic engine damage. Do not ignore an oil warning light.

symptom_short: Excessive smoke from exhaust

likely_causes.cause: White smoke: coolant entering combustion (possible head gasket)

recommended_checks: Note smoke color (blue, white, black) and smell.
Observe if smoke happens more on startup, acceleration, or all the time.
Check coolant level and oil level for unexplained loss.
safety_warning: Thick white steam with overheating can indicate serious engine damage — stop driving and have it checked.

symptom_short: Whining noise that changes with vehicle speed
recommended_checks: Note if noise changes when turning left or right.
Observe if pitch changes with throttle on/off or only with speed.
Have wheel bearings and differential fluid checked.
safety_warning: Severely worn bearings or gears can overheat and seize, potentially causing loss of control.

symptom_short: Clicking or popping when turning at low speed

likely_causes.cause: Outer CV joint wear on front-wheel-drive or AWD
Loose axle nut or suspension component

recommended_checks: Notice if sound is louder on full lock turns and during acceleration.
Determine if noise comes from one front corner.
Inspect CV boots for tears or missing grease.
safety_warning: Severely worn CV joints can eventually fail and leave the vehicle without drive.

symptom_short: Water on interior floor or wet carpet

likely_causes.cause: Heater core leak (if fluid feels oily and smells sweet)

recommended_checks: Check if liquid is clear water or colored coolant.
Notice if leak appears after rain or after running AC.
Touch liquid; coolant often feels slightly oily and has sweet smell.
safety_warning: Persistent moisture can lead to mold growth and electrical issues under the carpet.

symptom_short: Multiple warning lights suddenly on (ABS, traction, power steering)

likely_causes.cause: Charging system failure causing low voltage
CAN bus or module communication issue

recommended_checks: Note if steering becomes heavy or transmission shifts oddly.
Watch for dimming lights or slow accessories.
Have battery and charging system checked first.
safety_warning: If steering or braking assistance is lost, driving can become difficult. Pull over safely if the car no longer responds normally.

symptom_short: Engine idles unusually high when stopped

likely_causes.cause: Vacuum leak or stuck idle-air control
Throttle body contamination or electronic throttle fault
AC or electrical load increasing commanded idle

recommended_checks: Notice if high idle happens only when AC is on or always.
Check for check-engine light and stored codes.
Listen for whistling or hissing around intake hoses.
safety_warning: Very high idle can make the car creep strongly in gear; hold the brake firmly and use caution in tight spaces.

symptom_short: Squealing belt noise on cold start

likely_causes.cause: Weak belt tensioner or misaligned pulley

recommended_checks: Notice if noise disappears after a few minutes.
Check belt for cracks or glazing if visible.
Have belt tension and accessory pulleys inspected.
safety_warning: If the belt fails, you may lose power steering, charging, and cooling quickly.

symptom_short: Burning smell after driving

likely_causes.cause: Oil or fluid leaking onto hot exhaust

recommended_checks: Walk carefully around car and smell near each wheel (without touching hot parts).
Look for smoke from wheel areas or under hood.
Check for recent fluid leaks or spills during oil change.
safety_warning: If a wheel or brake smells extremely hot, avoid driving — a dragging brake can fail or catch fire.
